trial_identification.scientifictitle: Uterine cavity abnormalities in women with endometriosis: association or causal relation?

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions:
Office hysteroscopy will be done for examination of the uterine cavity in all included women with endometriois (that was confirmed using laparoscopy either in the same setting or in a previous one) for any abnormal pathology like uterine septum , endometrial polyp and contracted cavity .
Office hysteroscopy will be done once from day five to eight of menstrual cycle

primaryOutcome.outcome: diagnosis of uterine abnormalities such as endometrial polyp, uterine septum
primaryOutcome.timepoint: this will be diagnosed using the office hystroscopy in early days of follicular phase of he menstrual cycle from day 5 to day 8.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1- Age should be between 15-40 years. 2- Diagnosis of endometriosis either by laparoscopy or clear ultrasound evidence
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1- Patients that have any previous surgery of the intra uterine cavity. 2- Patients receiving any hormonal treatment for at least 6 months.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: this study will be conducted to evaluate the association of uterine cavity abnormalities with pelvic endometriosis using office hysteroscopy

ethicscommitee.ethicname: ethical committee , faculty of medicine ,alexandria university
